title: In Drought-Stricken California, Golden Is The New Brown
teaser: Rory Odelia Sher, 9, says if we think of brown as golden, Californians can come up with answers to the drought.
contentencoded:
Rory Odelia Sher says if we think of brown as golden, Californians can come up with answers to the drought.

Rory is 9 years old and just completed third grade at Katherine Delmar Burke School in San Francisco. Her commentary originally aired as a KQED Public Radio Perspective.

  • Read the full essay via KQED

Commentator

  • Rory Odelia Sher, 9-year-old who just completed third grade in San Francisco.
